network

Class PktReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.PktReader

  • public final class PktReader
extends java.lang.Object
    FULLY DOCUMENTED. UNSTABLE. This class is the first to receive telemetry packets. When it receives them, it adjusts their Endian, and sends them to all FswTlmObservers. A common error that can occur is if there is an existing JCAT instance listening to port 1235, the port where the CFS sends packets. If this happens, the new JCAT instance will not receive packets.
    Author:
    Joe Benassi, David McComas TODO Read in cFE headers like osconfig.h to get #defines. TODO Allow multiple instances of JCAT share the same socket. TODO Ensure that EnableWirelessTelemetry works cross-platform. TODO Ensure that EnableLocalTelemetry works cross-platform.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PktReader

        public PktReader()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start()
        If port 1235 is not occupied, it launches a thread to receive packets on that port every 40ms. If it IS occupied, this prints an exception and sets the variable 'functional' false. This method is called only once, and in JCAT's main method.

      • startThread

        private static void startThread()
        Starts a thread that receives all packets on port 1235. Updates the TopBar's 'last received packet' value, adjusts the header of packets based on the Endian, and sends all packets to each observer.

      • getWirelessIP

        public static java.lang.String getWirelessIP()
        Returns a String that equals either null or the wireless host address. Is fully-functional on Windows, but has not been tested on Linux or Mac platforms.
        Returns:
        A String equaling the host address of this machine. If this could not be determined, this will return null. TODO Ensure this works cross-platform.

      • getLocalIP

        public static java.lang.String getLocalIP()
        Returns a String that equals either null or the local host address. It is fully-functional on Windows, ut has not been tested on Linux or Mac platforms.
        Returns:
        A String equaling the host address of this machine. If this could not be determined, this returns null. TODO Ensure this works cross-platform.

      • getPort

        public static final java.lang.String getPort()
        Returns the port this listens for packets from. Currently 1235.
        Returns:
        The String "1235".

      • isFunctional

        public static boolean isFunctional()
        Returns if this is listening for telemetry packets.
        Returns:
        If the port '1235' on this machine was not occupied when JCAT launched.
